title: Claude Opus 4.6 with 1M Token Context
description: Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.6 with an experimental 1 million token context window, significantly improving long-context queries, reasoning, and planning capabilities. Additionally, Claude Code versions 2.1.0-2.1.2 were released in January 2026 with 80+ new features including skills hot reload, session teleportation, and enhanced agent capabilities.

community_feedback.quote: Opus 4.6 is the strongest model Anthropic has released. It actually executes complex requests to completion, breaking tasks into specific steps without needing hand-holding.
Excellent at complex multi-step coding, especially for Agent workflows requiring planning and tool calls. It's starting to unlock long-duration tasks.
Significantly better on harder problems. More resilient, better code reviews - when other models drop off on long tasks, it keeps going.
Opus 4.6 handled migrating millions of lines of code like a senior engineer - planning ahead, adjusting strategy while learning, completing in half the time.
Opus 4.6 autonomously closed 13 issues in one day, assigned 12 issues to correct team members, managing ~50-person organization across 6 code repositories.
Opus 4.6 has been castrated
Users complained about significantly degraded writing quality
I have Opus 4.6 + Claude Code run large repositories and complex requirements—multi-file backend services, frontend + API code, long requirement documents.
Opus 4.6被阉割了 (Opus 4.6 has been castrated) - 167 upvotes on Reddit criticizing degraded writing quality
High Ceiling, High Variance - excellent performance at times but occasionally overconfident and confidently talking nonsense
Opus 4.6 handles architecture planning better with 94.2% logical consistency vs GPT-5.3's 88.5%, but slower at ~95 tokens/second vs ~245 tokens/second

title: GPT-5.3-Codex Model Integration
description: GitHub rolled out OpenAI's GPT-5.3-Codex model to Copilot, delivering approximately 25% better performance for agentic coding tasks compared to GPT-5.2-Codex. The update significantly reduces wait times for complex workflows and is available for Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise users across VS Code, GitHub web, mobile, CLI, and Coding Agent environments.

community_feedback.quote: Developers expressed excitement about the improved speed and efficiency
Some users reported that it's 'significantly faster' than previous versions
Lower engagement compared to Claude Opus 4.6 - social media posts (likes, shares, comments) were less than half of Claude's announcement
Some developers questioned whether GPT-5.3-Codex still lags behind Claude Opus 4.6 in actual usage experience and safety
The model can still 'panic and rollback' after long refactoring sessions
GitHub paused GPT-5.3-Codex rollout due to reliability issues
Codex is excellent at discovering errors and minor inconsistencies. Claude Code is good at 'raw programming,' but Codex is invincible at carefully and systematically discovering 'problems.'
GPT-5.3 Codex positioned as 'interactive collaborator' where you guide it during execution vs Opus 4.6's more autonomous approach

title: Model Picker for Copilot Coding Agent on Mobile
description: GitHub Mobile added a new model picker feature for the Copilot Coding Agent, allowing subscribers to switch between different AI models. This feature is available for Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers.

title: Enhanced Symbol Context Tool
description: GitHub released a new find_symbol tool to unlock language-specific rich symbol context, improving code understanding and suggestions across different programming languages.

title: New Codex Accelerated Programming Release
description: OpenAI released a new Codex update focused on accelerating programming workflows with enhanced automated testing capabilities that can run multiple tests in parallel until code passes.

community_feedback.quote: Reports accelerated feature development, debugging, and testing
Uses it to accelerate repetitive tasks and improve test coverage
Helps write debugging tools and accelerate autonomous driving technology development
The Codex CLI repository gained 5,000 stars within just 5 hours of release
